intro: Madaria densifolia, commonly known as the denseleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Madaria densifolia is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
